title: Ticket #1951: condor_mail.exe is missing from Condor for windows
description:
condor_mail.exe is missing from the Windows distro, starting w/ CMake (what ever happened to comparing the files places in the old MakeMSI package -vs- what CMake plus WiX place in the new package??).

For v7.5.6, I propose it be placed into the .zip and .msi packages today "by hand". For v7.6.0 and beyond, obviously it should be built and packaged.
remarks:
2011-Mar-07 13:52:01 by tstclair:
Previously I had prebuilt, called it mail and put it in msconfig, b/c of issues with cmake and .net projects(http://public.kitware.com/Bug/view.php?id=9742&nbn=4). Another option would be to call out devenv on the project itself.

Or 3rd option, to convert it to native using the twelve million examples that exist.

2011-Mar-08 14:06:28 by ziliang:
Resorted to just prebuilding the thing. Tested in 7_6-branch. Though there are other implications of having a .NET application and not really declaring that fact while in the installer.

2011-Mar-30 15:15:26 by tstclair:
This can likely be closed out now.
check_ins: 2011-Mar-08 13:53   Check-in [20983]: Add condor_mail.exe as a binary blob since it is highly unlikely to ever see any changes unless we end up rewriting it as a native application. Add back in vcproj just in case there is a need to build it. Have CMake copy condor_email.exe when it does packaging into the bin folder. Ticket #1951. (By Ziliang Guo )
